Of course comes with our Manitoba potato homemade skinny fries!
 
$1 from every burger sold will be donated to the initiative to provide clean drinking water to our reserves via www.waterfirst.ngo
 
Even if you don't buy our burger, please go to the website and donate to this long overdue cause! Let's take a step toward making a difference!

recipe.name: JRC Big Mac(aron)
recipe.description:
Burger macs are back and are bigger than ever! Introducing our Le Burger Week entry: the JRC BIG MACaron!

Each BIG MACaron starts with a large macaron shell topped with sesame seeds and baked to perfection. A disc of chocolate coated feuilletine adds a waffle-cone crunch, then a delicious dark chocolate mousse 'patty' is covered with marshmallow fondant 'cheese' and stacked high with modelling chocolate 'lettuce', perfectly sweet royal icing 'mustard' and 'ketchup' and white chocolate 'mayo'. Our secret sauce? A mouthwatering strawberry jam made from local strawberries that adds a touch of tart to pair beautifully with the dark chocolate and sweet additions.

Each BIG MACaron comes on a gold disc in a pink burger box and is ready to be your sweet finish to a day of burger tasting from around Winnipeg!

Limited quantities available. Pick up dates are from September 1 - 14. Available to pre-order on jennaraecakes.com only.

*The Big Mac(aron) is vegetarian.

recipe.name: Bump Wellington
recipe.description:
The Bump Wellington starts with one (or two), mustard smashed patties made with our sustainable plant-enhanced* Bump Burger meat. It’s topped with a deconstructed duxelles made with fried mushrooms and thyme pickled shallots and red onion. For some added umami we top it with aged cheddar and a roasted garlic aioli. All of this nestled snuggly inside our house made, lattice topped milk bun.

*What do we mean by plant-enhanced exactly?

You may have seen that Le Burger Week is encouraging plant-based burgers this year to make the event more sustainable. We love the idea, but we’re still going to do things our way and use our plant-enhanced burger meat that gets 50% of its protein from plant-based sources and the other half from ordinary beef.

We do this because it allows us to make a burger that tastes delicious and meaty, and still has a fraction of the environmental impact of a regular burger. So, if you’re a vegetarian looking for a plant-based option, Bump Burger isn’t going to be for you. If you love meat, but want it to have a lower environmental impact, then come taste the delicious and unique Bump Wellington burger.

location.address: 420 Corydon Ave, Winnipeg, R3L 0N8 MB, Canada
